document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Lesteva Latreille, 1797 (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Omaliinae Anthophagini) of the Iberian Peninsula

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Lesteva Latreille, 1797 (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Omaliinae Anthophagini) of the Iberian Peninsula

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Daugavpils University, Institute of Life Sciences and Technology, Coleopterological Research Center, Vienibas 13, LV- 5401. Daugavpils, Latvia.
Museo Civico di Storia Naturale, Verona, Lungadige Porta Vittoria, 9, I- 37129, Verona, Italy.

subSubSection.paragraph:

7°33‘ 39W
. 1073 m a.s.l., bushes, under stones. 18.03.2002 . A. Lompe leg. (cA);

2400 m a.s.l.
25.08.2005
. A. Anichtchenko leg. (cSh)
;
CATALUñA
:

;

. P.N. Lawrence ( BMNH )
;

. ( ZMUC )
;
1 ♂ : Haut Atlas , NE Tizi-n-Test , 30°54’12N
08°18’ 39W

1 ♂ : ‘ Atlas […illegible...]’ ( BMNH )
.

Remarks.
Lesteva hanseni
is widely distributed in Europe ( Schülke & Smetana 2015 ). It was recorded from Morocco ( Coiffait 1973 ) and southern Spain ( Lohse 1960 ). Habitus as in Fig. 10 . The shape of the apical portion of the median lobe is somewhat variable ( Fig. 16 and Fig. 92c in Zanetti (1987)) . Lateral aspect of aedeagus as in Fig. 17 .
The species is here recorded from Portugal for the first time.
